alert.note: Alert for Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 1:07PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, Columbia, McDuffie and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Edgefield and McCormick. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional light rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aiken, North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Martinez, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Belvedere, Clearwater, Harlem, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta Mall, Riverwood, Augusta National Golf Club, Daniel Field, Summerville, Midtown, Glendale and Appling. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 176 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 6. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
